Karina Canellakis conducts Beethoven - Symphony No. 7 (2019)
Description:
American conductor Karina Canellakis leads the Swedish Radio Symphony Orchestra in a performance of Beethoven’s Symphony No. 7. It was recorded live on April 10, 2019.

More info about Ms. Canellakis can be found here: http://karinacanellakis.com/

Title: Ludwig van Beethoven - Symphony no. 7: Claudio Abbado conducting the LSO in 1984
Description:
Today I found a long-time-mislaid cassette containing this performance of Claudio Abbado conducting the LSO in Beethoven's seventh symphony, as part of their 1984 Royal Festival Hall Beethoven cycle. Included with it was a clip from the Sunday Times concert review: 'With playing as fine as this, any fears that the music may be over-familiar, disappear...'

1. Poco sostenuto – vivace 0:00
2. Allegretto 21:11
3. Presto – Assai meno presto 20:57
4. Allegro con brio 28:19

This channel is not associated in any way with the London Symphony Orchestra, or its own CD label, LSO LIVE. These are off-air audio recordings made by LSO fans over a period of some 70 years, and are not rips of LSO LIVE recordings or streamed transmissions. We have greatly enjoyed these performances over the years - all of which were at least four years old at the time of posting - and just wish to share them with other music lovers for the pleasure of listening to the LSO in live performances. No copyright infringement is intended; please make contact if there is an issue.

Title: Szell / Cleveland LIVE 1966: Beethoven symphony no.5 in C minor, op.67
Description: Concert from Severance Hall, ripped from the Memories disc MR2537 which gives the date as 22 September 1966. The concert was documented for the Bell Telephone Hour (see the film of the finale on https://youtu.be/pt_LIn3RE2I ).

Title: Szell and Cleveland LIVE in 1970: Beethoven symphony no. 3 in E flat (Eroica)
Description:
(Timings below.) Recorded live at Severance Hall in Cleveland on 7 May 1970. The broadcast begins with words from Szell about the shootings at Kent State University in Ohio earlier in the week. The concert contained Weber's overture to 'Oberon' [then Mozart's 40th, K550, not in this video] and the Beethoven. It was Szell's last performance of the Eroica in Cleveland, before the tour of Japan and Korea and his final concert in Anchorage which included the Eroica. According to Michael Charry's biography, after the 7 May concert Szell "allowed himself a rare bit of self-praise, saying 'Now THAT was a performance!' " (Charry p.284)

00:00 Szell's speech
01:35 Oberon overture
12:03 Beethoven 3:i Allegro con brio
28:05 Beethoven 3:ii Marcia funebre, Adagio assai
45:25 Beethoven 3:iii Scherzo, Allegro vivace - trio
51:50 Beethoven 3:iv Finale, Allegro molto, poco andante
